title: Baldwin County Airport
text:
Baldwin County Airport is a county-owned, public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> in <a href="Baldwin%20County%2C%20Georgia">Baldwin County, Georgia</a>, United States. It is located four <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (5 <a href="mile">mi</a>, 7 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) north of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Milledgeville%2C%20Georgia">Milledgeville, Georgia</a>. This airport is included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Facilities and aircraft.
Baldwin County Airport covers an area of 200 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (81 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 385 feet (117 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 10/28 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 5,509 by 99 feet (1,679 x 30 m).
For the 12-month period ending June 11, 2011, the airport had 10,000 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations, an average of 27 per day. At that time there were 23 aircraft based at this airport: 87% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a> and 13% multi-engine.
